alert.note: Alert for Sheridan (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 11 at 2:51PM MDT until May 12 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: .Rain continues to fall across the area, but amounts have mostly been less than expected. Most of the rivers have shown only some modest rises. The best rainfall amounts have been down along the Bighorn Mountains. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of north central Wyoming, including the following county, Sheridan. * WHEN...Through late Friday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - An additional 0.5 to 1.5 inches of rainfall is possible tonight through Friday night. This heavy rainfall could cause rivers and streams in the area to rise aggressively and possibly flood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
